column4: I have been trying for three days to get help making an HP 4050 print under Feisty.  No one ever seems to respond.  Please help. (2nd request today)
how is it connected?
direct connection via parallell
are you going through the gnome printer setup?

yes, the printer is detected an d appears to install but nothing prin ts, If i change the port to lpt1 it tries to print but errors out with an incorrect tray and paper type (which are not in the current configuration!)
lpt1 is DOS-speak. What's the real device name where your printer is detected?
the connection is "LPT parpart0 HPLIP"
is that what's configured at the moment?
yes it is And that does not print at all
also there are no error messages, it just does not print.
can you open a terminal and change to /var/log/cups
yes
run a 'ls -lrt' to see what the most recently changed file is in there (last line). The error log?
error_log  owned by lpadmin  and when i cat that file I get "cupsdAuthorize: Local authentication certificate not found!
run 'groups'. Are you in lpadmin?
yes I am according to the user gui, just typing "groups" I cannot tell from that.
'groups | grep -q lpadmin && echo YES, I\'m in lpadmin'
well it said "Yes I am"
does the date of that file match with your most recent printing attempt?
yes
could you put the entire error_log on http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org please
I just received a phone call and must leave immediately, I'm sorry especially now that I'm getting assistance - I will be back in about 2.5-3 hours, will you still be on the forum then?
probably not, but try again occasionally. I think you have a directory permissions problem. Purging and reinstalling cups *may* help. Laters!
thank you
